intro: Schmaltzia allophyloides, commonly known as the narrowleaf schmaltzia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its small, showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and it produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. Schmaltzia allophyloides is often found in desert or semi-arid environments, adapting well to harsh conditions.
